author: eniko1555
content:
Hello <@686695036733227017> 

Just wanted to update you that I now have a two-week window to review the project proposal for the deb repository. During this time, I've gathered some questions and developed a basic understanding of how this project should unfold.

By the way, people were just discussing setting up the node. Considering that, should we open a thread here (on Discord) to discuss the questions, or would you prefer if I DM you directly?

author: mariohavel
content: Great, thanks for sharing! If you ran into something and want to discuss publicly, feel free to open a thread here.

author: wzht
content: I spoke to Ben Edgington about this a while ago, it's on my very long TODO project list (effectively a black hole)... completely forgot about it until now. Very cool... if there's time in the EPF are we allowed to contribute to a second project ad-hoc?

author: mariohavel
content: Sure you can contribute to various projects, it's all up to you, just keep in mind keeping the scope of your work doable

author: parithosh
content:
You can also use geth's built in devp2p tool to gather connectivity related status and info:
`./devp2p rlpx ping enode://.....`

author: angaz
content: Yeah. I haven't looked into it too deeply yet, but I would assume it's using devp2p as a library, not a subprocess.
